intro: Gaudichaudia californica, commonly known as the California gaudy scale, is a species of scale insect native to the western United States. It is characterized by its distinctive, colorful, waxy covering that can range from red to orange and yellow. The plant is often found on the stems and leaves of various host plants, including shrubs and trees. Its life cycle involves a complex series of developmental stages, including egg, larva, nymph, and adult. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to both entomologists and horticulturists.
